channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023061654
item.description:
Report X-2023061654

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat shipment was brought over form trailer unload. Package handler stated the box fell off of the noncompliant conveyer belt. When it fell it tipped upside down, and started to leak. DescribePack: All of the plastic bottle bottles didn't have inner cap seals. 2 had visibly loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package handler put the box in a plastic spill bag. then it was put into a have mat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061627
item.description:
Report X-2023061627

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: MOSINEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Brought to QA after discovered crushed and leaking in unload. Probably fell during transportation in a trailer. DescribePack: Leaking from the crimped metal drum top. No punctures. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put in bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023061624
item.description:
Report X-2023061624

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: LA CROSSE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came out of Trailer leaking, and was upside down on Trailer DescribePack: Loose cap on one bottle of bathroom cleaner AF79 Concentrate DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into hazmat tote using proper PPE.

item.title: Report X-2023061534
item.description:
Report X-2023061534

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 8:30AM a package was brought over by a driver, who said it was left under the belt line. DescribePack: Cap burst off on 1 gallon. Dents on bottoms of all containers suggest it sustained a drop. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Nothing was done properly. Management was notified that not only did the driver bring it over himself, but the package handler had left it under the belt system and never notified QA.

item.title: Report E-2023060742
item.description:
Report E-2023060742

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of razorlube (un1268) had a loose bung cap and had released 3 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
